name: Planet of the Capes Trivia Game | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Known as the Dark Knight, which caped crusader is the alter ego of Bruce Wayne?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	Created by Bob Kane and Bill Finger, Batman debuted in comics in 1939. It wasn't until 1968 that Batman first appeared in animation when he was featured in episodes of "Superman".   Over the years more than a dozen actors have played the character in animation.

questions.text: Clark Kent is better known as which costumed crimefighter?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	The Man of Steel was created in Ohio by writer Jerry Siegel and artist Joe Shuster in 1933. However he wouldn't appear in a published comic until 1938, which is the date he is officially considered to have been created.  He moved into animation in 1941 when Max Fleischer animated him in seventeen shorts that were aired at movie theaters. Bud Collyer was the voice actor at the time.

questions.text: In the 1990s, which character saw a resurgence when he was brought back to host "Coast to Coast", a fictional talk show?
questions.explanation:
Space Ghost.

	Space Ghost was created in the mid-1960s for Hannah Barbera animation. He was a mainstay of the shows of that era then mostly went away. At the time he was a serious superhero figure. The character was brought back in 1994 as a jocular talk show host. In 2011, the character was reintroduced as a serious crime fighter in a comic book series from DC Comics.

questions.text: Did the Flash wear a cape during his 1990s era television show?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Not only did the character not wear a cape, he didn't have his own animated television show in the 1990s either. The character, was however featured in other character's shows and as part of various "Justice League" shows.

questions.text: J'onn J'onzz is a character from another world. What is his extraterrestrial superhero name?
questions.explanation:
Martian Manhunter.

	The Martian Manhunter is almost always portrayed as the last surviving member of his race. He travelled to Earth and used his powers to fit in, eventually becoming a crime fighter as well. His animation appearances are normally in ensemble casts, rarely as the main character of an episode.

questions.text: Susan Storm, or The Invisible Woman, is sometimes portrayed with a cape (when you can see her at all, that is). What superhero team is she a part of?
questions.explanation:
The Fantastic Four.

	There have been several "Fantastic Four" animated films since they were created by Stan Lee in the 1960s. Sue Storm is most often portrayed as the girlfriend or wife of Reed Richards and sister of Johnny Storm, two of her team mates. She typically has the powers of invisibility, astral projection and force field creation.

questions.text: Jubilee, one of the X-Men, almost always wore a bright yellow cape as part of her costume.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The character, one of the younger team members in 1992's "X-Men" the animated series, typically wore a yellow trenchcoat. During that series she was never shown with a cape. The character has a fascination with Wolverine during the series, much the same as the Rogue character had in the live-action movies based around the franchise.

questions.text: Which of the following characters was portrayed more often in animation wearing a cape?
questions.explanation:
Powergirl.

	Gamora, Catwoman and The Phoenix have all rarely if ever worn a cape during their animated appearances. All three typically have more skintight outfits. Catwoman and Gamora both started out as criminals turned hero. Powergirl typically is portrayed as having strength and flight similar to Superman, and a yellow cape to offset her white outfit as well.

questions.text: Batgirl has been portrayed as being many different woman in various incarnations. Which version of the character was in "Batman: The Animated Series"?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Gordon.

	The Barbara Gordon version of Batgirl is the police commissioner's daughter. This is the most common version of the character in both animation and comics. Gordon succeeds where her father has failed, she uncovers Batman's secret identity and ends up one of his teammates during the run of the series.

questions.text: Among the X-Men characters listed, which one wore a cape?
questions.explanation:
Storm.

	During "X-Men" 1992, Beast wasn't even always portrayed as wearing a shirt, since he was hairy all over. In the same series Wolverine and Cyclops traditionally wore the standard X-Men garb. Storm, on the other hand, wore a white jumpsuit with a long cape.
